meanings.definition: Grinches (noun): plural form of grinch, a mean-spirited or selfish person
meanings.sent1: The group of grinches refused to share their toys with others.
meanings.sent2: The town was full of grinches who never participated in community events.
meanings.sent3: The grinches at the party hoarded all the snacks for themselves.
meanings.sent4: Her classmates were like grinches, always trying to ruin her day.
meanings.sent5: Beware of the grinches lurking in the shadows, waiting to spoil the fun.

meanings.definition: Grinches (verb): third person singular present of grin, to smile broadly
meanings.sent1: She grinches whenever she sees puppies playing in the park.
meanings.sent2: The children giggle and grinches with joy as they open their presents.
meanings.sent3: The baby grinned and grinches at the funny faces her dad made.
meanings.sent4: The old man grinches as he reminisces about his youth.
meanings.sent5: The sunsets always make her grinches with delight at their beauty.

meanings.definition: Grinches (adjective): describing someone or something as resembling the character of the Grinch, from Dr. Seuss' book 'How the Grinch Stole Christmas'
meanings.sent1: The grumpy cat had a grinches expression on its face all day.
meanings.sent2: The dark clouds gave the sky a grinches appearance before the storm.
meanings.sent3: The grumpy customer had a grinches attitude towards the service.
meanings.sent4: His grinches behavior during the holidays surprised everyone.
meanings.sent5: The grinches decorations on the house made it stand out on the street.
